result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel Ruelas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
In 14CF133, deft will please to Cts 1 & 2, Ct 3 is DRI. 14CF1349, deft will plead to Ct 1, Ct 2 is DRI - State recommends a period of probation. In 15CF369, deft will plead to Cts 4 & 5, balance are DRI. The state recommends 2 yrs probation.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have received and reviewed the report from Dr. Pankiewicz. Neither party objects to the findings. The Court has also reviewed a report from Dr. Luzi who also opines that the defendant is competent.
Upon plea to 14CF1349, Ct 1, Ct 2 will be DRI-9 mos RCJ/CFTS; 14CF1343, Ct 1 and Ct 2, Ct 3 is DRI; probation; 15CF369, plea to Ct 4 and Ct 5 - balance DRI; w/held sentence - 2 yrs probation.

BTC: Dr. Pankiewicz opines that the deftendant is competent in all three matters as does Dr. Luzi in the follow up report dated 9/11. The Court will adopt those findings and find the defendant competent to proceed.
           The matter is to be set over - the defendant is not understanding cmpletely today
Dr. Mary Kay Luzi

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for  Sharon A Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Walker was literally just given discovery from previous counsel. The competency hearing is to be moved up to 9/21 at 11:30 am

BTC: competency hearing moved up to 9/21 to stay within statutory time limits  Competency hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 11:30 am.
allowing Ms. Kuehn to withdraw as counsel
Atty Laura Walker

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Kuehn indicates that she went to RCJ yesterday and she does not feel defendant is understanding what she is saying to him. Ms. Kuehn again raises competency. The Court conducts colloquy with the defendant. Defense indicates defendant will not sign change of plea forms.

Defendant now wants to go to trial. Ms. Kuehn is still concerned about competency. Ms. Kuehn indicates that she is taking a personal extended leave and asks to withdraw.

BTC: Ms. Kuehn may withdraw. New counsel to be appointed. Competency exam is ordered. 14CF1343 will be tried first. All files to be set for JT.  Status conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

BTC: Witness MR - with Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez, advises needs to speak to an Atty, will adjoun for one week  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Interpreter Daniel Lopez appears for the victim.
Mr. Hamad has been allowed to withdraw. The State indicates that a competency evaluation was done and ultimately, the defendant was found competent. The defense is not contesting the finding of competence.
Defense indicates they concur with the finding of the doctor

BTC: Defendant is competent to proceed in this matter. PH to be set in 15CF369, the other cases will track  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has received a report by Dr. Pankiewicz. Parties have reviewed same. Defense indicates that he met with deft yesterday to discuss the report and the global report. Defense indicates there has been a breakdown in communication between he and the defendant and therefore, motions the Court to allow him to withdraw. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant.

BTC: Mr. Hamad may withdraw. SPD shall reappoint. The defendant is warned that this is not a revolving door. The next attorney appointed is the attorney deft will have to deal with. Competency will be addressed at that time  Competency hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
ATTY Hamad filing copy of letter sent to ZCI.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Mr. Hamad indicates that offer was contingent on clean ZCI and deft's last ZCI was not clean. Defense asks for a future court date and asks for COP.
The State indicates it is the intent to resolve the case. The State will give deft one more opportunity

BTC: May set for COP. If deft tests dirty, the Court will not accept plea deal. Deft to be tested after court today and one week prior to COP  Plea hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
ZCI

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Raymond Gamez.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Reading waived.
NG plea entered.
Raymond Gamez
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on October 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Raymond Gamez.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
